$ul: **payload**: An object containing the payload, if any, of the event.
**time_created**: [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) formatted string for when this resource was created.

**time_event**: [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) formatted string for when this event was generated on the device. This is the device's own timestamp. Could be different due to buffering and clock differences.
**time_expire**: [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) formatted string for when this resource is going to be deleted.
**action**: Indicates the kind of event that was executed. In most cases it's a verb. I.e. 'connected', 'created' etc...
**arguments**: Extra arguments may be added to a topic string, it depends on the `resource_type` and the `action` what extra arguments are added.
**resource_type**: The The available event topic resources types on the API. Is written in its plural form.
